perturbation.original_text: The undersigned understands and agrees that as to GSMS he is an "affiliate" under Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), and the undersigned anticipates that he will be such an "affiliate" at the time of the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned understands and agrees that as to GSMS he may or may not be considered an "affiliate" depending on the interpretation of Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), and the determination will be made at the sole discretion of PSS legal counsel at the time of the Merger.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines the undersigned as an 'affiliate'. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating that the 'affiliate' status is subject to interpretation and the discretion of PSS legal counsel. This contradicts the original clear definition, creating uncertainty about the undersigned's status and the associated obligations.

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned understands that PSS is under no obligation to file a registration statement with the SEC covering the disposition of the undersigned's shares of PSS Common Stock or to take any other action necessary to make compliance with an exemption from such registration available.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned understands that PSS may, at its sole discretion, file a registration statement with the SEC covering the disposition of the undersigned's shares of PSS Common Stock or take other actions necessary to facilitate compliance with an exemption from such registration, depending on the overall financial strategy of PSS at the time of disposition.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that PSS has 'no obligation' to file a registration statement. The modified text contradicts this by saying PSS 'may, at its sole discretion,' file such a statement. This introduces uncertainty about PSS's responsibility and the conditions under which they might assist with the disposition of shares, potentially conflicting with the affiliate's understanding of their rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees, for a period of three years after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS will use commercially reasonable efforts, but is not required, for a period of three years after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. The availability of such filings for the benefit of the undersigned in relation to Rule 145(d) compliance cannot be guaranteed.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that PSS 'agrees...to file on a timely basis' reports. The modified text weakens this obligation by stating that PSS is not required but 'will use commercially reasonable efforts,' and explicitly states that the availability of such reports is not guaranteed. This creates uncertainty and contradicts the original commitment, possibly affecting the affiliate's ability to transfer shares under Rule 145(d).
